solution_line_template: Maria's deduction for tax is {salary} x {tax_percent}% = $<<{salary}*{tax_percent}*{percent_factor}={tax_deduction}>>{tax_deduction}.
Her deduction for insurance is {salary} x {insurance_percent}% = $<<{salary}*{insurance_percent}*{percent_factor}={insurance_deduction}>>{insurance_deduction}.
After the deductions, Maria has only ${salary} - ${total_deductions} = $<<{salary}-{total_deductions}={after_deductions}>>{after_deductions} left from her salary.
Then, Maria pays ${after_deductions}/{utility_divisor} = $<<{after_deductions}/{utility_divisor}={utility_bills}>>{utility_bills} for the utility bills.
So, Maria has ${after_deductions} - ${utility_bills} = $<<{after_deductions}-{utility_bills}={after_utilities}>>{after_utilities} after the deductions and utility bills payment.
